text.p: Egyptian share prices hit an 18-month high in active trading on Wednesday as new investors continued to buy, brokers said.
The Capital Market Authority (CMA) all-share index closed 0.52 points higher at 234.81 after shares worth 45.96 million pounds ($13.5 million) changed hands.
"Many newcomers are buying big volumes," said broker Sherif Cararah of Financial Brokerage Group. "It will continue."
Watany Bank of Egypt, the most active share, rose 1.99 pounds to end at 27.00 pounds after more than 50,000 shares changed hands.
Milling shares continued to dominate activity with Central Egypt Flour Mills down 0.99 pounds to 25 pounds after 11,349 shares changed hands.
"Central performed well in anticipation of good results," Cararah said. There were rumours yesterday that the firm had increased net profits for 1995/69 by 30 percent.
North Cairo Flour Mills closed 0.01 pounds up at 94.35 pounds after some 22,000 shares were traded.
The CMA index for openly traded firms firmed to 339.55 points from 337.53 on Tuesday and the index for rarely traded "closed" firms went marginally down to 160.60 from 160.96.
Gaining stocks outnumbered losers 25 to 10 while another 18 firms were traded but ended unchanged.
